00047  * Macros defined for the radio transceiver's access modes.

00076 void hal_spi_init(void)
00077 {
00078     /*SPI Specific Initialization.*/
00079     //Set SCK and MOSI as output.
00080     HAL_DDR_SPI  |= (1 << HAL_DD_SCK) | (1 << HAL_DD_MOSI);
00081     HAL_PORT_SPI |= (1 << HAL_DD_SCK); //Set CLK high
00082     // Setup slave select pin as output, and high
00083     HAL_DDR_SS  |= (1 << SSPIN);
00084     HAL_PORT_SS |= (1 << SSPIN);
00085 
00086     //Enable SPI module and master operation.
00087     SPCR         = (1 << SPE) | (1 << MSTR);
00088     //Enable doubled SPI speed in master mode.
00089     SPSR         = (1 << SPI2X);
00090 }

00095 void hal_init(void)
00096 {
00097     /*IO Specific Initialization.*/
00098     DDR_SLP_TR |= (1 << SLP_TR); //Enable SLP_TR as output.
00099     DDR_RST    |= (1 << RST);    //Enable RST as output.
00100 
00101     hal_spi_init();
00102     hal_enable_trx_interrupt();    //Enable interrupts from the radio transceiver.
00103 }

00115 u8 hal_register_read(u8 address)
00116 {
00117     //Add the register read command to the register address.
00118     //    address &= HAL_TRX_CMD_RADDRM;
00119     address |= HAL_TRX_CMD_RR;
00120 
00121     u8 register_value = 0;
00122 
00123     AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00124 
00125     HAL_SS_LOW(); //Start the SPI transaction by pulling the Slave Select low.
00126 
00127     /*Send Register address and read register content.*/
00128     SPDR = address;
00129     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00130     register_value = SPDR;
00131 
00132     SPDR = register_value;
00133     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00134     register_value = SPDR;
00135 
00136     HAL_SS_HIGH(); //End the transaction by pulling the Slave Select High.
00137 
00138     AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00139 
00140     return register_value;
00141 }

00152 void hal_register_write(u8 address, u8 value)
00153 {
00154     //Add the Register Write command to the address.
00155     address = HAL_TRX_CMD_RW | (HAL_TRX_CMD_RADDRM & address);
00156 
00157     AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00158 
00159     HAL_SS_LOW(); //Start the SPI transaction by pulling the Slave Select low.
00160 
00161     /*Send Register address and write register content.*/
00162     SPDR = address;
00163     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00164     SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00165 
00166     SPDR = value;
00167     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00168     SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00169 
00170     HAL_SS_HIGH(); //End the transaction by pulling the Slave Slect High.
00171 
00172     AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00173 
00174     // Set the rx_mode variable based on how we set the radio
00175     if ((address & ~HAL_TRX_CMD_RW) == RG_TRX_STATE)
00176     {
00177         // set rx_mode flag based on mode we're changing to
00178         value &= 0x1f;   // Mask for TRX_STATE register
00179         if (value == RX_ON ||
00180             value == RX_AACK_ON)
00181             rx_mode = true;
00182         else
00183             rx_mode = false;
00184     }
00185 }

00198 u8 hal_subregister_read(u8 address, u8 mask, u8 position)
00199 {
00200     //Read current register value and mask out subregister.
00201     u8 register_value = hal_register_read(address);
00202     register_value &= mask;
00203     register_value >>= position; //Align subregister value.
00204 
00205     return register_value;
00206 }
00207 
00220 void hal_subregister_write(u8 address, u8 mask, u8 position,
00221                             u8 value)
00222 {
00223     //Read current register value and mask area outside the subregister.
00224     u8 register_value = hal_register_read(address);
00225     register_value &= ~mask;
00226 
00227     //Start preparing the new subregister value. shift in place and mask.
00228     value <<= position;
00229     value &= mask;
00230 
00231     value |= register_value; //Set the new subregister value.
00232 
00233     //Write the modified register value.
00234     hal_register_write(address, value);
00235 }

00245 void hal_frame_read(void)
00246 {
00247     u8 *rx_data=mac_buffer_rx;
00248     rx_frame_t *rx_frame=(rx_frame_t*)mac_buffer_rx;
00249 
00250     AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00251 
00252     HAL_SS_LOW();
00253 
00254     /*Send frame read command.*/
00255     SPDR = HAL_TRX_CMD_FR;
00256     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00257     u8 frame_length = SPDR;
00258 
00259     /*Read frame length.*/
00260     SPDR = frame_length;
00261     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00262     frame_length = SPDR;
00263 
00264     /*Check for correct frame length.*/
00265     if ((frame_length >= HAL_MIN_FRAME_LENGTH) && (frame_length <= HAL_MAX_FRAME_LENGTH))
00266     {
00267         *rx_data++ = frame_length; //Store frame length.
00268 
00269         /*Upload frame buffer to data pointer. Calculate CRC.*/
00270         SPDR = frame_length;
00271         while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0)
00272             ;
00273 
00274         do
00275         {
00276             u8 tempData = SPDR;
00277             SPDR = 0;       // dummy write
00278 
00279             *rx_data++ = tempData;
00280             while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0)
00281                 ;
00282         } while (--frame_length > 0);
00283 
00284         /*Read LQI value for this frame.*/
00285         rx_frame->lqi = SPDR;
00286 
00287         HAL_SS_HIGH();
00288     }
00289     else
00290     {
00291         HAL_SS_HIGH();
00292 
00293         if (rx_frame)
00294         {
00295             rx_frame->length = 0;
00296             rx_frame->lqi    = 0;
00297             rx_frame->crc    = false;
00298         }
00299     }
00300 
00301     AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00302 }

00311 void hal_frame_write(u8 *write_buffer, u8 length)
00312 {
00313     length &= HAL_TRX_CMD_RADDRM; //Truncate length to maximum frame length.
00314 
00315     AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00316 
00317     //Toggle the SLP_TR pin to initiate the frame transmission.
00318     hal_set_slptr_high();
00319     hal_set_slptr_low();
00320 
00321     HAL_SS_LOW(); //Initiate the SPI transaction.
00322 
00323     /*SEND FRAME WRITE COMMAND AND FRAME LENGTH.*/
00324     SPDR = HAL_TRX_CMD_FW;
00325     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00326     SPDR; // Dummy read of SPDR
00327 
00328     SPDR = length;
00329     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00330     SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00331 
00332     // Download to the Frame Buffer.
00333     do
00334     {
00335         SPDR = *write_buffer++;
00336         --length;
00337 
00338         while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0)
00339             ;
00340 
00341         SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00342     } while (length > 0);
00343 
00344     HAL_SS_HIGH(); //Terminate SPI transaction.
00345 
00346     AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00347 }

00358 void hal_sram_read(u8 address, u8 length, u8 *data)
00359 {
00360     AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00361 
00362     HAL_SS_LOW(); //Initiate the SPI transaction.
00363 
00364     /*Send SRAM read command.*/
00365     SPDR = HAL_TRX_CMD_SR;
00366     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0)
00367         ;
00368     SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00369 
00370     /*Send address where to start reading.*/
00371     SPDR = address;
00372     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0)
00373         ;
00374     SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00375 
00376     /*Upload the chosen memory area.*/
00377     do
00378     {
00379         SPDR = HAL_DUMMY_READ;
00380         while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00381         *data++ = SPDR;
00382     } while (--length > 0);
00383 
00384     HAL_SS_HIGH();
00385 
00386     AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00387 }

00398 void hal_sram_write(u8 address, u8 length, u8 *data)
00399 {
00400     AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00401 
00402     HAL_SS_LOW();
00403 
00404     /*Send SRAM write command.*/
00405     SPDR = HAL_TRX_CMD_SW;
00406     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00407     SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00408 
00409     /*Send address where to start writing to.*/
00410     SPDR = address;
00411     while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0)
00412         ;
00413     SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00414 
00415     /*Upload the chosen memory area.*/
00416     do
00417     {
00418         SPDR = *data++;
00419         while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0)
00420             ;
00421         SPDR;  // Dummy read of SPDR
00422     } while (--length > 0);
00423 
00424     HAL_SS_HIGH();
00425 
00426     AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00427 }

00436 void RADIO_VECT(void);
00437 #else  /* !DOXYGEN */
00438 ISR(RADIO_VECT)
00439 {
00440     /*Read Interrupt source.*/
00441     u8 interrupt_source = hal_register_read(RG_IRQ_STATUS);
00442 
00443     if (interrupt_source & HAL_TRX_END_MASK)
00444         radioTrxEndEvent();
00445 
00446     // Energy detect event
00447     if (interrupt_source & HAL_ED_READY_MASK)
00448         macEdCallback();
00449 
00450     /* Handle the incomming interrupt. Prioritized.
00451        Other Interrupts: 
00452        HAL_TRX_UR_MASK
00453        HAL_PLL_UNLOCK_MASK
00454        HAL_PLL_LOCK_MASK
00455     */
00456     if ((interrupt_source & HAL_RX_START_MASK))
00457     {
00458         /*Read Frame length and call rx_start callback.*/
00459         HAL_SS_LOW();
00460 
00461         SPDR = HAL_TRX_CMD_FR;
00462         while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00463         SPDR;
00464 
00465         SPDR = 0; // Send dummy byte so we can read one byte back
00466         while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}
00467         u8 frame_length = SPDR;
00468 
00469         HAL_SS_HIGH();
00470 
00471         radioRxStartEvent(frame_length);
00472     }
00473     else if (interrupt_source & HAL_BAT_LOW_MASK)
00474     {
00475         //Disable BAT_LOW interrupt to prevent interrupt storm. The interrupt
00476         //will continously be signaled when the supply voltage is less than the
00477         //user defined voltage threshold.
00478         u8 trx_isr_mask = hal_register_read(RG_IRQ_MASK);
00479         trx_isr_mask &= ~HAL_BAT_LOW_MASK;
00480         hal_register_write(RG_IRQ_MASK, trx_isr_mask);
00481     }
00482     else
00483         ; // unknown ISR
00484 }

00496 bool calibrate_rc_osc(void)
00497 {
00498     if (SERIAL && F_CPU >= 2000000UL) // only need for making serial port work
00499     {
00500         bool success = false;
00501         static bool once=0;
00502 
00503         if (once)
00504             // Only calibrate once
00505             return true;
00506 
00507         once = true;
00508 
00509         // Use the 1 MHz CLK_M from the AT86RF230.
00510         volatile u16 temp;
00511         u16 counter;
00512         u8 osccal_saved;
00513         u8 tccr2b, tccr1b, tccr1a;
00514 
00515         // in the following line, 1000000ULL represents the 1MHz input signal
00516         // from the radio.  265 is the number of counts to overflow 8-bit
00517         // timer 2.  32 is the divide by 32 prescaler for timer 1.  F_CPU is
00518         // the main clock frequency.
00519 #define TARGETVAL ((1000000ULL * 256 * 32) / F_CPU)
00520 
00521         // Timer 1 (16-bit) is run from the 1MHz RF23x CLKM signal, which gives
00522         //   1uS/count.  This timer measures how long it takes for
00523         //   timer2 to overflow
00524         // Timer 2 (8-bit) is run from the main CPU clock divided by
00525         //   32.  This means the clock is 31250Hz at 1MHz, or 250KHz at 8MHz.
00526         //   Target time is 1024uS (8MHz) or 8192uS (1MHz).
00527 
00528         osccal_saved = OSCCAL;
00529         cli();
00530 
00531         radioSetClockSpeed(true, CLKM_1MHz);
00532 
00533         // Save current values of timer status.
00534         tccr2b = TCCR2B;
00535         tccr1b = TCCR1B;
00536         tccr1a = TCCR1A;
00537 
00538         // Stop timers 1 and 2.
00539         // Set timer 1 to normal mode (no CTC, no PWM, just count).
00540         TCCR2B = 0;
00541         TCCR1B = 0;
00542         TCCR1A = 0;
00543 
00544         for (counter = 0; counter < 1000;  counter++)
00545         {
00546             // Timer 2 driven from clock divided by 32
00547             TCCR2B = (1 << CS21) | (1 << CS20);
00548             // Timer 1 driven with external clock
00549             TCCR1B = (1 << CS12) | (1 << CS11);
00550 
00551             // Clear pending timer 1 and 2 interrupts, and clear the
00552             // counters.
00553             TCNT2 = 0;
00554             TCNT1 = 0;
00555             TIFR1 = 0xFF;
00556             TIFR2 = 0xFF;
00557 
00558             // Wait for timer 2 to overflow.
00559             while (!(TIFR2 & (1 << TOV2)))
00560                 ;
00561 
00562             temp = TCNT1;
00563 
00564 
00565             // Stop timer 1.  Now, TCNT1 contains the number of 1MHz RF2xx cycles
00566             // counted while timer 2 was counting CPU cycles
00567             TCCR1B = 0;
00568             TCCR2B = 0;
00569 
00570             if (temp < (u16)(0.995 * TARGETVAL))
00571             {
00572                 // Too fast, slow down
00573                 OSCCAL--;
00574             }
00575             else if (temp > (u16)(1.005 * TARGETVAL))
00576             {
00577                 // Too slow, speed up
00578                 OSCCAL++;
00579             }
00580             else
00581             {
00582                 // We are within +/- 0.5 % of our target frequency, so we're
00583                 // done.
00584                 success = true;
00585                 break;
00586             }
00587         }
00588 
00589         radioSetClockSpeed(true, CLKM_DISABLED);
00590 
00591         // restore timer status regs
00592         TCCR2B = tccr2b;
00593         TCCR1B = tccr1b;
00594         TCCR1A = tccr1a;
00595         if (!success)
00596         {
00597             // We failed, therefore restore previous OSCCAL value.
00598             OSCCAL = osccal_saved;
00599         }
00600 
00601         return success;
00602     }
00603     else
00604         return 0;
00605 }

00638 void halSetupClock(void)
00639 {
00640     // Set clock speed based on F_CPU flag
00641     if (F_CPU == 4000000UL)
00642     {
00643         AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00644         CLKPR = 1 << CLKPCE;  // Set the change-enable flag
00645         CLKPR = 1;            // Set for divide-by-two, or 4MHz
00646         AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00647     }
00648     if (F_CPU == 2000000UL)
00649     {
00650         AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00651         CLKPR = 1 << CLKPCE;  // Set the change-enable flag
00652         CLKPR = 2;            // Set for divide-by-four, or 2MHz
00653         AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00654     }
00655     if (F_CPU == 1000000UL)
00656     {
00657         AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00658         CLKPR = 1 << CLKPCE;  // Set the change-enable flag
00659         CLKPR = 3;            // Set for divide-by-eight, or 1MHz
00660         AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00661     }
00662 
00663 }
